data.text:
@discoball2000 Australia has dropped most of those things, apart from QR codes at medical practices. This has been the case since we have been 85% vaccinated.

We got through it because we put in the hard groundwork back in 2020 and 2021.
@discoball2000 Well piss off to that country then if you are not happy here.
@discoball2000 Free university education and healthcare.....and now only slightly more expensive than Australia with a more commonsense approach to the new virus.
@discoball2000 @DanielAndrewsMP another one. All living their best lives because politicians were willing to give up power that clearly you are not. #Elections2022 👋

@lurchthrilla @discoball2000 Yes and before the change (do correct me if I'm wrong) from MoH website I was under the impression it was longer:

"*This total [86] differs to the number of announced COVID-19 deaths (98) as the latter includes deaths that occurred more than 28 days after a case was reported"
@discoball2000 Anyway, I totally disagree that deaths within 28 days is a 'useless stat', and excess deaths is not as clear a measure of covid deaths.
@bedward36141403 Yes and deaths are a lagging measure. Regardless, compared to pretty much anywhere else in the west Danish excess deaths are very low.
@discoball2000 This is how it looks now - all much lower https://t.co/danEguL3pL
